verses.plain: Blessed is the man that hath not slipped with his mouth, and is not pricked with the multitude of sins.

tokens.t: Blessed is the man that hath not slipped with his mouth, and is not pricked with the multitude of sins.

verses.plain: Blessed is he whose conscience hath not condemned him, and who is not fallen from his hope in the Lord.

tokens.t: Blessed is he whose conscience hath not condemned him, and who is not fallen from his hope in the Lord.

verses.plain: Riches are not comely for a niggard: and what should an envious man do with money?

tokens.t: Riches are not comely for a niggard: and what should an envious man do with money?

verses.plain: He that gathereth by defrauding his own soul gathereth for others, that shall spend his goods riotously.

tokens.t: He that gathereth by defrauding his own soul gathereth for others, that shall spend his goods riotously.

verses.plain: He that is evil to himself, to whom will he be good? he shall not take pleasure in his goods.

tokens.t: He that is evil to himself, to whom will he be good? he shall not take pleasure in his goods.

verses.plain: There is none worse than he that envieth himself; and this is a recompence of his wickedness.

tokens.t: There is none worse than he that envieth himself; and this is a recompence of his wickedness.

verses.plain: And if he doeth good, he doeth it unwillingly; and at the last he will declare his wickedness.

tokens.t: And if he doeth good, he doeth it unwillingly; and at the last he will declare his wickedness.

verses.plain: The envious man hath a wicked eye; he turneth away his face, and despiseth men.

tokens.t: The envious man hath a wicked eye; he turneth away his face, and despiseth men.

verses.plain: A covetous man’s eye is not satisfied with his portion; and the iniquity of the wicked drieth up his soul.

tokens.t: A covetous man’s eye is not satisfied with his portion; and the iniquity of the wicked drieth up his soul.

verses.plain: A wicked eye envieth his bread, and he is a niggard at his table.

tokens.t: A wicked eye envieth
bread, and he is a niggard at his table.

verses.plain: My son, according to thy ability do good to thyself, and give the Lord his due offering.

tokens.t: My son, according to thy ability do good to thyself, and give the Lord his due offering.

verses.plain: Remember that death will not be long in coming, and that the covenant of the grave is not shewed unto thee.

tokens.t: Remember that death will not be long in coming, and that the covenant of the grave is not shewed unto thee.

verses.plain: Do good unto thy friend before thou die, and according to thy ability stretch out thy hand and give to him.

tokens.t: Do good unto thy friend before thou die, and according to thy ability stretch out thy hand and give to him.

verses.plain: Defraud not thyself of the good day, and let not the part of a good desire overpass thee.

tokens.t: Defraud not thyself of the good day, and let not the part of a good desire overpass thee.

verses.plain: Shalt thou not leave thy travails unto another? and thy labours to be divided by lot?

tokens.t: Shalt thou not leave thy travails unto another? and thy labours to be divided by lot?

verses.plain: Give, and take, and sanctify thy soul; for there is no seeking of dainties in the grave.

tokens.t: Give, and take, and sanctify thy soul; for there is no seeking of dainties in the grave.

verses.plain: All flesh waxeth old as a garment: for the covenant from the beginning is, Thou shalt die the death.

tokens.t: All flesh waxeth old as a garment: for the covenant from the beginning is, Thou shalt die the death.

verses.plain: As of the green leaves on a thick tree, some fall, and some grow; so is the generation of flesh and blood, one cometh to an end, and another is born.

tokens.t: As of the green leaves on a thick tree, some fall, and some grow; so is the generation of flesh and blood, one cometh to an end, and another is born.

verses.plain: Every work rotteth and consumeth away, and the worker thereof shall go withal.

tokens.t: Every work rotteth and consumeth away, and the worker thereof shall go withal.

verses.plain: Blessed is the man that doth meditate good things in wisdom, and that reasoneth of holy things by his understanding.

tokens.t: Blessed is the man that doth meditate good things in wisdom, and that reasoneth of holy things by his understanding.

verses.plain: He that considereth her ways in his heart shall also have understanding in her secrets.

tokens.t: He that considereth her ways in his heart shall also have understanding in her secrets.

verses.plain: Go after her as one that traceth, and lie in wait in her ways.

tokens.t: Go after her as one that traceth, and lie in wait in her ways.

verses.plain: He that prieth in at her windows shall also hearken at her doors.

tokens.t: He that prieth in at her windows shall also hearken at her doors.

verses.plain: He that doth lodge near her house shall also fasten a pin in her walls.

tokens.t: He that doth lodge near her house shall also fasten a pin in her walls.

verses.plain: He shall pitch his tent nigh unto her, and shall lodge in a lodging where good things are.

tokens.t: He shall pitch his tent nigh unto her, and shall lodge in a lodging where good things are.

verses.plain: He shall set his children under her shelter, and shall lodge under her branches.

tokens.t: He shall set his children under her shelter, and shall lodge under her branches.

verses.plain: By her he shall be covered from heat, and in her glory shall he dwell.

tokens.t: By her he shall be covered from heat, and in her glory shall he dwell.
